articles.author: Tommy Nguyen
articles.description:
Last week was a turning point for me. I had the chance to speak at two conferences (FinOpsX 2025 and HAProxyConf 2025) in the same week, and I finally met someone I‚Äôve admired for years. These experiences opened my eyes to how much we can learn when stepping outside the usual environment and talking to people from different backgrounds, industries, and stages of their careers. 

At both events, I found myself surrounded by people with different stories and perspectives. Some were just starting out, others were industry veterans, and everyone had something unique to share. Listening to their experiences made me realize how valuable it is to look beyond and see what‚Äôs happening in the wider world. It‚Äôs easy to get caught up in daily work, but when we zoom out, we can find new ideas and inspi‚Ä¶
articles.title: What I Learned by Looking Outside

articles.author: Mahmoud Harmouch
articles.description:
Welcome üëã!
So I came across the Frontend Challenge: June Celebrations (CSS Art) on dev.to, and I thought: "Hey, what if I build a handy dandy crate for our gay friends that they can slap onto their rusty websites?" This way, I learn a bit more about CSS, make something useful, and give Ferris the crab ü¶Ä a chance to finally come out of the shell.
And so, Pride RS was born.
Pride RS is a drop-in, customizable rusty component for rendering LGBTQ+ pride flags directly in your Rust frontend. From celebrating Pride Month, to adding some rainbow love to your app, or just want a vertical NonBinary flag for reasons between you and your browser, Pride RS makes it extremely easy.
Flags are rendered using flex-direction, composed of CSS-powered color stripes that flex in all the right directions: ho‚Ä¶
articles.title: üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà Pride RS: LGBTQ+ Flag Component for Rust Frontends

articles.author: Rvn
articles.description:
Hey dev.to üëã
Ravan, a 17-year-old full-stack developer who's been deep in code for the past 10 months.
Since I started, I‚Äôve spent over 3000 hours learning, building, and breaking things on purpose ‚Äî just to understand how they work. I‚Äôve written over 100,000 lines of code, mostly across full-stack projects.
My main stack:
Vue, JavaScript, TypeScript, Node.js, and sometimes Python, Java, or raw HTML/CSS when needed.
I care a lot about:
üß† Writing clean, maintainable code
üõ†Ô∏è Building scalable backend architectures
üîç Debugging smarter, not harder
üí° Turning ideas into real, working systems
Outside of coding, I enjoy thinking about strategy, leadership, and systems ‚Äî stuff I believe overlaps with building good software.
I'll be sharing things I learn here:
Dev experiments
Coding techniques I find useful
Thoughts on mindset and growth as a young dev
I‚Äôm still early in my journey, but I‚Äôm moving fast ‚Äî and I‚Äôm here to learn and contribute along the way.
Let‚Äôs connect ‚ö°
Feel free to share what you‚Äôre working on or learning right now üëá
articles.title: üöÄ 17 and Full-Stack: My Dev Journey So Far

articles.author: Ritesh Kokam
articles.description:
Artificial intelligence (AI) has the potential to revolutionize the world, but with great power comes great responsibility. As AI becomes more advanced and integrated into our daily lives, we must ensure that it is developed and used ethically. In this article, we will explore the ethics of AI and how we can ensure that AI is developed and used responsibly.
AI ethics is a branch of ethics that focuses on the ethical considerations of artificial intelligence. It is concerned with ensuring that AI is developed and used in a way that is transparent, accountable, and respects human rights.
AI has the potential to improve our lives in countless ways, from healthcare to transportation to education. However, as AI becomes more advanced and integrated into our daily lives, it also has the potentia‚Ä¶
articles.title: The Ethics of Artificial Intelligence

Welcome, aspiring artisan of the web! You stand at the threshold of a new adventure, a journey into the world of Laravel ‚Äì a PHP framework renowned for its elegance, simplicity, and robust power. Think of Laravel not just as a tool, but as a finely crafted workshop, equipped with everything you need to build beautiful, functional, and scalable web applications. This guide is your first map, designed to lead you, step by step, from a curious beginner to a confident creator. Let's ignite that spark and begin.

Before we can sculpt our digital masterpieces, we need to prepare our workspace. Laravel, like any powerful toolset, has a few prerequisites.

articles.author: Bob Otieno Okech
articles.description:
In the rush to develop cutting-edge AI agents, one critical skill often gets overlooked: data warehousing. While AI algorithms and machine learning frameworks grab the spotlight, the backbone of any scalable, high-performing AI system lies in how data is structured, stored, and accessed.
A well-designed data warehouse, built on the principles of dimensional modeling, ensures that AI agents can efficiently process vast amounts of data, deliver real-time insights, and adapt to evolving business needs. This article explores why data warehousing and dimensional modeling are indispensable for AI scalability and how their components work together to power intelligent systems.
AI agents thrive on data. Whether they're generating insights, making predictions, or automating decisions, they rely on ‚Ä¶
articles.title: The Role of Data Warehousing and Dimensional Modeling in Building a Scalable Data Warehouse for AI Agents
